maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Adds an owner or member to the team, and to the unified group which backs the team.
Note: the command will return immediately, but the Teams application will not reflect the update immediately. The Teams application may need to be open for up to an hour before changes are reflected.
To turn an existing Member into an Owner, first Add-TeamUser -Role Owner -User foo to add them to the owners list, then Remove-TeamUser -User foo to remove them from the members list.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)
Member or Owner
GroupId of the team
User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)
Member or Owner

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Gets all the teams that the user belongs to.
Gets all the teams the user is part of. The user must be you - you can only get information on yourself.

maml:Description.maml:para: User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)
User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
GroupId of the team

Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Gets team member settings.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
GroupId of the team

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
GroupId of the team

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Returns users of a team.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
Filter the results to only users with the given role: Owner, Member, or Guest.
GroupId of the team
Filter the results to only users with the given role: Owner, Member, or Guest.

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Creates a new team. The new team will be backed by a new unified group.
Creates a new team with user specified settings, and returns a Group object with a GroupID property.

maml:Description.maml:para: Team access type. Valid values are "Private" and "Public". Default is "Private". (This parameter has the same meaning as -AccessType in New-UnifiedGroup.)
This setting lets you decide if you will be added as a member of the team. The default is true.
Same as displayName without any spaces. Team Alias Characters Limit - 64
Team classification
Team description. Team Description Characters Limit - 1024.
Team display name. Team Name Characters Limit - 256.
Team access type. Valid values are "Private" and "Public". Default is "Private". (This parameter has the same meaning as -AccessType in New-UnifiedGroup.)
This setting lets you decide if you will be added as a member of the team. The default is true.
Same as displayName without any spaces. Team Alias Characters Limit - 64
Team classification
Team description. Team Description Characters Limit - 1024.
Team display name. Team Name Characters Limit - 256.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-Team -DisplayName "Tech Reads" -Description "Team to post technical articles and blogs" -AccessType Public

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-MicrosoftTeams -AccountId myaccount@example.com $group = New-Team -alias “TestTeam” -displayname “Test Teams” -AccessType “private” Add-TeamUser -GroupId $group.GroupId -User "fred@example.com" Add-TeamUser -GroupId $group.GroupId -User "john@example.com" Add-TeamUser -GroupId $group.GroupId -User "wilma@example.com" New-TeamChannel -GroupId $group.GroupId -DisplayName "Q4 planning" New-TeamChannel -GroupId $group.GroupId -DisplayName "Exec status" New-TeamChannel -GroupId $group.GroupId -DisplayName "Contracts" Set-TeamFunSettings -GroupId $group.GroupId -AllowCustomMemes true

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Add a new channel to a team.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
Channel display name. Names must be 50 characters or less, and can't contain the characters # % & * { } / \ : < > ? + | ' "
Channel description. Channel description can be up to 1024 characters.
GroupId of the team
Channel display name. Names must be 50 characters or less, and can't contain the characters # % & * { } / \ : < > ? + | ' "
Channel description. Channel description can be up to 1024 characters.

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Deletes a team.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
GroupId of the team

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Delete a channel. This will not delete content in associated tabs.

Note: The channel will be "soft deleted", meaning the contents are not permanently deleted for a time. So a subsequent call to Add-TeamChannel using the same channel name will fail if enough time has not passed.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
Channel name to be deleted
GroupId of the team
Channel name to be deleted

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Remove an owner or member from a team, and to the unified group which backs the team.
Note: the command will return immediately, but the Teams application will not reflect the update immediately. The Teams application may need to be open for up to an hour before changes are reflected.
Note: last owner cannot be removed from the team.
To turn an existing Member into an Owner, first Add-TeamUser -Role Owner -User foo, then Remove-TeamUser -User foo to remove them from the members list.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)
GroupId of the team
User's UPN (user principal name - e.g. johndoe@example.com)

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Updates a team.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
Team display name. Team Name Characters Limit - 256.
Team description. Team Description Characters Limit - 1024.
Same as displayName without any spaces. Team Alias Characters Limit - 64
Team classification.
Team access type. Valid values are "Private" and "Public"
GroupId of the team
Team display name. Team Name Characters Limit - 256.
Team description. Team Description Characters Limit - 1024.
Same as displayName without any spaces. Team Alias Characters Limit - 64
Team classification.
Team access type. Valid values are "Private" and "Public"

Updated Channel description. Channel Description Characters Limit - 1024.
GroupId of the team
Current channel name
New Channel display name. Names must be 50 characters or less, and can't contain the characters # % & * { } / \ : < > ? + | ' "
Updated Channel description. Channel Description Characters Limit - 1024.

Enable Stickers and memes
Allow custom memes to be uploaded

Enable Stickers and memes

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Updates team messaging settings.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
Setting to allow user to edit messages
Setting to allow user to delete messages
Setting to allow owner to Delete messages
Allow @team or @[team name] mentions. This will notify everyone in the team
Allow @channel or @[channel name] mentions. This wil notify members who've favorited that channel

Setting to allow owner to Delete messages

maml:description.maml:para: Note: This cmdlet is currently in Beta.
Update the team picture.
Note: the command will return immediately, but the Teams application will not reflect the update immediately. The Teams application may need to be open for up to an hour before changes are reflected.

maml:Description.maml:para: GroupId of the team
File path and image ( .png, .gif, .jpg, or .jpeg)
GroupId of the team
File path and image ( .png, .gif, .jpg, or .jpeg)
